text.0: wisely have i enjoyed the savoury viand religiousthoughted best to find out treasure.
text.1: the food to which all deities and mortals calling it meath gather themselves together.
text.2: tlou shalt be aditi as thou hast entered within appeaser of celestial anger.
text.3: indu enjoying indras friendship bring usas a swift steed the carforward to riches.
text.4: we have drunk soma and become immortal we have attained the light the gods discovered.
text.5: now what may foemans malice do to harm us what o immortal mortal mans deception.
text.6: absorbed into the heart be sweet o indu as a kind father to his son o soma.
text.7: as a wise friend to friend do thou wideruler o soma lengthen out our days for living.
text.8: these glorious drops that give me freedom have i drunk closely they knit my joints as straps secure a car.
text.9: let them protect my foot from slipping on the way yea let the drops i drink preserve me from disease.
text.10: make me shine bright like fire produced by friction give us a clearer sight and make us better.
text.11: for in carouse i think of thee o soma shall i as a rich man attain to comfort.
text.12: may we enjoy with an enlivened spirit the juice thou givest like ancestral riches.
text.13: o soma king prolong thou our existence as sūrya makes the shining days grow longer.
text.14: king soma favour us and make us prosper we are thy devotees of this be mindful.
text.15: spirit and power are fresh in us o indu give us not up unto our foemans pleasure.
text.16: for thou hast settled in each joint o soma aim of mens eyes and guardian of our bodies.
text.17: when we offend against thine holy statutes as a kind friend god best of all be gracious.
text.18: may i be with the friend whose heart is tender who lord of bays when quaffed will never harm me.
text.19: this soma now deposited within me for this i pray for longer life to indra.
text.20: our maladies have lost their strength and vanished they feared and passed away into the darkness.
text.21: soma hath risen in us exceeding mighty and we are come where men prolong existence.
text.22: fathers that indu which our hearts have drunken immortal in himself hath entered mortals.
text.23: so let us serve this soma with oblation and rest securely in his grace and favour.
text.24: associate with the fathers thou o soma hast spread thyself abroad through earth and heaven.
text.25: so with oblation let us serve thee indu and so let us become the lords of riches.
text.26: give us your blessing o ye gods preservers never may sleep or idle talk control us.
text.27: but evermore may we as friends of soma speak to the synod with brave sons around us.
text.28: on all sides soma thou art our lifegiver aim of all eyes lightfinder come within us.
text.29: indu of one accord with thy protections both from behind and from before preserve us.
